name: Imputation of data
desc: Process of replacing missing data with substituted (estimated) values.

name: Data Cleaning
desc: Detecting and correcting corrupt or inaccurate observations from a database and identifying incomplete, incorrect, inaccurate or irrelevant data features or observations and then replacing, modifying, or deleting the dirty data.

name: Feature Transformation
desc: Group of techniques to create new features to gain discriminatory power, using the existing ones, by scaling or normalizing, projections, transforming categorical to numerical, etc.

name: Feature Selection
desc: Techniques to select a subset of relevant features to be used in modeling stage.

name: Dimensionality Reduction
desc: To reduce the number of features by obtaining a set of representative features sometimes as a combination of the original ones.

name: Feature Space
desc: Set of features used to characterize the data set. The n-dimensions where the data live.

name: EDA
desc: A set of techniques to summarize the main characteristics of a data set, often using visual methods.

name: ETL
desc: Extract, Transform, and Load. ETL systems extract data from one system, transform the data and load the data into a database or data warehouse.

name: Inference
desc: A representation used in natural language processing. A text is represented as the bag of its words, disregarding grammar and even word order but keeping multiplicity.

name: Data Cleaning
desc: Detecting and correcting corrupt or inaccurate observations from a database and identifying incomplete, incorrect, inaccurate or irrelevant data features or observations and then replacing, modifying, or deleting the dirty data.
